alert.note: Alert for Alachua; Bradford; Columbia; Union (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 10 at 7:12PM EST until March 10 at 7:30PM EST by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EST FOR WEST CENTRAL BRADFORD...NORTH CENTRAL ALACHUA...SOUTHWESTERN UNION AND SOUTHEASTERN COLUMBIA COUNTIES... At 711 PM EST, a severe thunderstorm was located over Providence, or 7 miles northwest of Worthington Spring, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Lake Butler, Worthington Spring, Worthington Springs, Upland Pines, Groves, Providence, Beasley, La Crosse, Brooker and Dukes. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
